title: Introducing: Cholombian
content:
Turn off X-Factor, put your phone on silent and recall your finest pair of headphones, ‘cus Cholombian is taking you on a journey.

Hailing from Southampton, his ambient soundscapes are engrossing in a way that is rarely possible. On his new EP, entitled II, there’s a delicately moving knowledge of atmosphere that elevates it above the vast majority of instrumental producers, fusing piano chords, glitchy beats and reverbed samples to expert effect. Bitter Ends draws the listener right to the edge, dangling them precariously before jolting them back into reality, flowing straight into the simplistically resplendent Like Caged Animals.

Technically, there’s no ground breaking musicianship, but it’s Cholombian’s ability to piece together his tracks in such a versatile way that allows this EP to succeed. A wash with drone based synths and lose hi-hats, you will find few listening experiences like it this year. There’s an underlying post-rock influence to his work, that prevents it from becoming stagnant and self-indulgent, leading the listener on a stimulatingly organic experience. Check out Bitter Ends below, and head over to Cholombian’s bandcamp to grab the rest of the EP for free.
